sen.e: Kinhira SAIONJI (1264 - October. 23, 1315) was a Kugyo (high-ranking court official) during the late Kamakura period.

sen.j: 1299年（正安元年）のとき右大臣に就き、更に父実兼の関東申次を継ぎ、大覚寺統・持明院統問題に際して権力を振りかざす。
sen.e: In 1299 He became Udaijin (minister of the right), and also succeeded his father Sanekane as Kanto moshitsugi (a functionary of carrying on the negotiations between the civil and military authorities), and then he fully demonstrated his power over the struggle for succession to the Imperial Throne between the Daikakuji line and the Jimyo-in line.

In 1299 he became Udaijin (minister of the right) and also succeeded his father Sanekane as Kanto moshitsugi (court-appointed liaison with the bakufu), and then he fully demonstrated his power over the struggle for succession to the Imperial Throne between the Daikakuji-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama) and the Jimyoin-to (imperial lineage from Emperor Gofukakusa to Emperor Gokomatsu).

sen.j: だが、後宇多上皇に内緒で常盤井宮恒明親王擁立に動いたことで大覚寺統から忌避されるようになると権力に翳りも見られた。
sen.e: However, his campaign for the enthronement of Tokiwai no miya Imperial Prince Tsuneaki without the knowledge of the Retired Emperor Gouda made the people of the Daikakuji line shun him, and his power decayed.
